column4: can someone sort out this sources.list entry for me? deb http://ftp.ale.org/pub/mirrors/ubuntu/ hoary hoary-backports hoary-security hoary-updates
why the heck does ubuntu have everyone using sudo instead of just switching to root?
sounds kind of assinine to me
deb http://ftp.ale.org/pub/mirrors/ubuntu/ hoary hoary-backports hoary-security hoary-updates  <--what is wrong with that line?
why can't my freind seem to get that to work/
apt is built to use both http and ftp
http://ftp. just sounds wrong to me
the kernel will not upgraded in the repos
why the furk not?
because programs and kernel stay in the released versions
what the heck does that mean?
the current released versions of the software in the repos are the only versions that will ever be put in them?
it means they extensively test versions of things before a release and that stability is more important than newest versions
yes
for a good reason
does that also mean that we wont be getting the newest gaim? they changed names for 2.0.0 it's now pidgin
yes
some things are back-ported
gaim is probably a good candidate
yes i am correct, or yes we will be getting the new pidgin?
yes, you are correct
You will almost certainly be able to get the latest gaim either in backports or 3rd party repos
